38782215.review:
Toy trains are something that have always been very satisfying to watch, at least for me anyways. So I figured a sandbox game based around getting to build train tracks would be pretty enjoyable, but sadly it just wasnt. I only played the game for around 15 minutes but even that was enough to see what this game was all about. 

I was immediately met with a confusing control scheme that did not allow for any kind of customization, and just feels frustrating to use. Traditionally games will have the player move with WSAD, jump with spacebar, and use shift, Q, and E for extra actions. In this game, you move with WSAD, use Q and E to adjust the height of the camera, and use space, ctrl, and alt for extra actions. It was painful to play with, and again, there are no custom control option.

Now onto the gameplay. You can start in a blank void or a blank void with a few pieces of furniture in it, and then go on ahead to start building your track. But apparently you can only build in a straight line, because there is no way to build separate tracks branching off of existing tracks without looping all the way around what youve already built. It just felt like a dumb design choice. And a lot of the placeable objects need to be unlocked before you can use them, which I did not even have the patience or capacity to do after seeing the rough shape of this game.

Overall, this game has potential but it is not enjoyable in its current state. Maybe one day in the future I will give it another try and end up loving it, but for now I have issued a refund.

38508335.review:
It's a tough call. It's such a simple game, and for such a good price, who wouldn't want to have this cute little sandbox. There isn't much content though, that's the problem.

I understand it's supposed to invoke nostalgia, but having 4 map options is a bit bare seeming to me, for a fully released game. It has wonderful music, and it's well designed.

After 90 or so minutes of playing, I'm just starting to get used to the controls. For some reason, I still don't know how to put the train back on the track once I've managed to fly it off.

It'll definitely help to get a bit of practice with this one, and give your undivided attention to the very brief tutorial.

The pieces are well designed, however there aren't many. Even I remember there being more thomas the tank engine pieces than what was given in this game. It's cute with all of the graphics and UI, but more content would be awesome.

If I'm going to give an honest rating, I'd say it's 7.5/10. I'm a little disappointed that the "controls" section isn't customizable, and that it's very lacking in information. It doesn't even tell you all of the controls (that's probably my issue about the train not going back on the track). I'm saying 7.5 because it's very simple, and it's a fun way to relax and unwind after a stressful day. The graphics are very pleasant to look at, so that's a bonus!

That said, this might get boring fast with not much content offered.

Hope you found this helpful!

37992236.review:
Tracks – The Train Set Game:
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
 
Well, this game took me straight down memory lane wearing the biggest smile I have produced for many years. You see, my late Dad was a train enthusiast, with a video gallery of thousands of hours that he had filmed since the late 60’s. That’s not all, he made several N (size of the set) model train sets (his biggest one was eight by four meters) which we used to play together every fortnight. I think he would have been as proud as punch to see me having a go at Tracks – The Train Set Game!

Tracks – The Train Set Game is a wooden train simulator with a great building component for you to create your biggest and most imaginative train set.

The game is currently on Early Access and offers a few modes of play. Two of them are free play, plus a daytime and a night time setup.  With both of these modes you’ll start with an empty canvas and a few pieces of track where your wooden train stands. From here, it will be all up to you and your imagination - you can build a set as big and as crazy as you like! Get the track to go up into a spiral, create lengthy straight lines with firecrackers along each side of the track which will alight as you pass through at full speed with your wooden train. That’s not all; create villages with houses, trees, fences, benches, lights and many more buildings and objects. You might find that constructing platforms is a good idea, so that you can stop the train and pick up passengers, moving them to one of the other majestic destinations you’ve created. Another fun thing to do is to stop the track with a pile of blocks, and then fly your train straight into it! Or just fly over it - lots of fun! 

The passenger mode has objectives to complete and it is set in a room with furniture. Here you have to build the track, pick up passengers from a specific location and drop them at another one. On some occasions, you’ll have to complete this within a certain period of time, which can become a bit challenging. 

In regards to the gameplay, it is so easy to build tracks, add buildings and objects. The only aspect which might take a little time to get used to is when you take control of the train and you need to stop at platforms. Thankfully, you can reverse if you miss it. This is an excellent pastime which you can come back to whenever you feel like it and pick up on your last saved game. There is an upload option in the settings, but at this stage, I was unable to use it.

Graphically, the game looks good and runs well. I really like the piano melody in the background which makes the experience even more enjoyable. It would be nice if we could customize the wooden train a little bit, add hills and tunnels. In any case, I look forward to playing the full version.

Positives:
~~~~~~~ 

-	Nice Graphics
-	Few modes of play (free play & objective)
-	Fun and easy to play 

Negatives:
~~~~~~~~  

-	It would be nice to add hills and build tunnels
-	No achievements or trading cards

Well, most boys played trains in their early youth . . . Girls, come and have a look at what you missed!

7/10

Key provided by developer/publisher for review purposes. Any opinions expressed are entirely my own!

36586181.review:
[h1]Early Access Review - Will edit as the game develops![/h1]

I saw this and instantly wanted to play it! Everyone who grew up in the early years knew of these iconic train sets. I had them in the early 90s and even IKEA sells their own brand of wooden train set! Anyway, you have an engine to start and a single piece of track. The rest is entirely up to you.

The physics engine makes it fun to knock over blocks or boxes or just send your engine flying off the track. Build up or build down and then decorate it to make it your own. It’s simplistic, it’s relaxing, and it’s fun. Lose yourself in the nostalgia gameplay as you build up your little train town.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
You start with a single engine on a piece of track. From there, you can add as many tracks as you see fit. You can access the Toy Box by hitting G to see all the neat things that can make your little train town stand out. Or maybe you’d rather keep it simple and prefer the look of the wood alone.

It’s up to you. Building is super easy with Left Click to lay track and Right Click to remove it. WASD moves you around, Q and E raises and lowers the camera as well as the track elevation, and T let’s you become the conductor! Control the speed of the train with W and S and track switching with A and D.

There are so many different buildings, structures, objects, and stations to put down with more being added. The developer is active on the discussion boards and the game is a blast to play in EA. I tend to lose myself just building and I do like that I get to ride in the trains and pick up passengers. The clear night environment is probably my favorite so far. 

[h1]Closing thoughts[/h1]
I love trains. I grew up on them with my dad building them in the basement. He’d buy me these wooden train sets when he came back from deployment. So, being able to relive my childhood, playing with one of my favorite toys as a kid without fear of losing my pieces is fantastic. The game is simple in its design, but fun to play. Especially if you have an eye for design and a love for building. The music does get a bit repetitive, but I wasn’t paying any attention to it since I was so focused on building.

The game controls well and as of this review, I haven’t heard mention of controller support or it’s limited at the moment. I’m excited for this game and to see what it can become. There are talks to be able to customize the color of tracks or engines and different types of train cars. Guess we’ll see!

36028456.review:
You really have to judge this game for what it is, and not expect it to be something that it isn't. 

Firstly, it's in Early Access, so it's not finished yet. I'm sure there will be much more content as time goes on. Right now, if you're looking for some kind of sophisticated world-building game à la Cities: Skylines or Cities in Motion, you're going to be disappointed. In its current state, this is more of a toy than any kind of simulator. It's the toystore wooden train set you wanted as a kid. There are a few dozen props to be added to the sandbox-style world, plus a basic set of wooden track pieces, and that's it.

Secondly, it shows a lot of potential. Some of the items (loading and unloading points, for example) suggest that the devs are working on adding more complex mechanics to the game. New gamemodes and the ability to create scenarios for the Workshop seem to be in motion already.

With all of that said, what you [i]do[/i] get with Tracks in its current form is absolutely charming. The little wooden passengers bopping around excitedly as you pull into a station or roll up next to a platform are adorable. Driving your train is a smooth and enjoyable experience. Graphics are very nice. A lot of care has obviously gone into each of the little props, from stations and platforms to fountains. The "Random House" function is great, adding variety to your scenery automatically by placing one of three different sized houses randomly each time you click. The music is relaxing and pleasant. You can already build multi-level networks and multiple types of stations, as well as crossovers that allow you to decide between multiple routes while driving.

All in all, I think that Tracks is a wonderfully charming little toy. It's enjoyable and relaxing to play with and shows a lot of promise for what's to come in future updates. The devs are clearly putting a lot of care into making it a visually appealing product rather than just focusing on creating as [i]much[/i] content as possible, which is appreciated. I'm really impressed with it and can't wait to see where it goes.

此游戏的key自奶牛关社区的野蔷薇计划获得，感谢开发者与相关社区工作人员的努力。



+  有趣的游戏创意

+ 高自由度

- 玩法略显单一

- 操作不便

- 游戏经常崩溃

总评：4.8/10，框架不错但内容空洞的轨道模型模拟游戏，期待脱离EA阶时游戏会有更好的表现。



孩子们都有那么一套小火车：一圈窄小的轨道，一个小小的火车头，以及一堆塑料小人。刚拿到手时，孩子们会认真地将轨道连接好，摆上电动小火车，看着它不知疲倦地一圈一圈旋转，尝试在家里的每一个地方都铺上轨道——然后被大人们制止，轨道被拆开，丢的哪儿都是；塑料小人被男孩们拿去，当成“打仗”的“士兵”；失去动力的小火车头被女孩们拾走，成了过家家游戏中的“大哥大”...

《Tracks - The Train Set Game》给了玩家一个机会，一个让儿时的小火车重新出发的机会。游戏中，玩家需要在空地、客厅等场景设置站台与车站来容纳乘客与货物，并为小火车铺设轨道穿梭其间，按照任务需求进行运输，获得点数解锁新的装饰物与建筑。

空旷的场地与几种简单的轨道变形结合，让玩家能够在游戏中按照自己的想法架设轨道从最简单的直线回环，到螺旋升天的花式变幻，甚至可以不铺设轨道，让火车脱轨“飙车”，满足玩家回归童年的愿望。

另一方面，高自由度约等于玩法单一，没有火车模拟游戏最重要的变轨、信号灯等要素，轨道变形的选择不多，使得游戏的玩法显得极为单一，不过考虑到目前游戏还处于EA模式，我们只能寄望于开发者的努力。

游戏采用了虚幻引擎，一定程度上保证了物理引擎与画面的质量，但也大大增加了游戏崩溃的概率...平均每两个场景，游戏就会崩溃一次，对游戏体验的影响极大，希望这一问题能尽快得到解决。

35788985.review:
I have a wooden train set sitting around somewhere as a leftover from when I was younger. I forget how I found Tracks, but when I saw it I was surprised such a game even existed and bought it without a second thought. Playing with the infinite amount of track (and very lenient laws of physics) rekindled the nostalgic spark of imagination and wonder I always had when building my own tracks, and actually lets me live one of my childhood dreams of having just that: infinite track and more lenient laws of physics.

The Passengers mode even gave me an excuse to use my imagination a little more freely without feeling silly; they're actual little wooden figures that need to get from point A to point B, not invisible figments like what I'd played with as a child, so if you're concerned about this, don't be, although if you don't care, there's a completely clear environment where you can play to the heart's content of your inner child.

The gentle music in the background and the woodgrain of the tracks, trains, and passengers, as well as the design of the buildings and props, is all very relaxing. I've found myself sitting for [many {many}] hours on end just building, and being perfectly okay with that.

I don't have many complaints with the game, and those I do mostly have to do with the turnout/switching system. My physical set had a few more types of switch tracks than the game has to offer at this point, and when actually playing the role of Conductor actually getting the train to divert to a branch line can be a little unreliable.
Additionally, the tracks won't join properly on rare occasions, especially when using the straight elevation changing sections, which will cause the train to derail and fall through a track that otherwise looks like a perfectly solid section of track.
The game at the time of this post, however, is far from finished, and even in this early state is not only playable, but also enjoyable, so it's easy to look past them and have an idea of the direction in which this game is going. A direction I, and many others, all say is a good one.

If you had or always wanted a wooden train set as a kid (or even a plastic one like one of my old sets) and don't mind the occasional hiccup, then I highly recommend this game. If those hiccups are too discouraging, then add it to your wishlist, wait a month or so, and THEN buy the game. If you have a friend or child that is even moderately into trains, then buy them a copy of this game and they'll love you forever for it. The developers are still making improvements, are very attentive to the community, and are open to suggestions for additions & improvements, which is always a good thing.

35706337.review:
A few things strike me about this lovely game:

-The cheerful piano music in the background. Together with the wooden railway-building and train-driving, the experience feels relaxing and meditative. 

-The game's creator has been wonderfully friendly and open to the early adopters of this game. He's engaged and helpful and open to ideas...which is awesome.

-The game has a wonderfully calming and cheering effect on my train-obsessed 8-year-old son. He has ADHD and is on the high-functioning end of the Autism spectrum (aka Aspergers, prior to DSM-V). We've been collecting wooden trains, tracks and destinations for 6+ years now; building tracks literally all over the house seems entirely normal to us :).

-My son has been playing the Beta edition for a couple of months; he's become a great fan of the game. We happened to search for Train-related games on Steam on Sept. 28...on release day :)! He was ecstatic, and has been playing regularly ever since.

-To my son, making up complex scenarios where his (very anthropomorphic) trains help each other, or (more often) intentionally crash into each other, fall off cliffs and become (friendly) ghost trains is a key part of "playing trains". As new features are developed & added, I hope the game creator continues to include features that facilitate this creative, sandbox style of play. 

(Cranes, tunnels, water features to interact with...a way to visually modify your engines, i.e. a related paint or basic 3D modeling program where you can add graphic details or even components to your engines and rolling stock...so many awesome possibilities!)

Highly recommended, if you're looking for a game involving trains and sandbox-style play.

感谢奶牛关野蔷薇提供的游戏资格。
图文评测见[url=https://cowlevel.net/people/osakitenko/review]奶牛关[/url]

[b]首先这款游戏尚处于early access阶段，所以还是很不完善的。[/b]

还记得，童年时无忧无虑地享受堆砌积木时，那份纯真的快乐吗？
这款游戏便是给大家提供了一个自由假设铁轨，布置街路的机会，如果在现实生活中压力太大而郁郁不闷，不妨打开这款游戏，听着舒缓的音乐，铺设自己的交通路线，开着低速挡，徜徉在街道之中，欣赏沿途的景色。

现在主要有2个模式，一个是沙盒模式，可以自由地摆设物件，架设轨道。另一个模式则是旅客模式。值得注意的是，旅客模式需要先假设platform（平台），在游戏中按G键打开，按R键调整方向，假设完成后，旅客会自动聚集到站台上。

游戏中按T键可以切换成火车模式WS键换挡，AD键选择方向，再按下T键可以切回沙盒，但是个人而言，还是觉得沙盒模式的操作方式很不友好，鼠标滚轮或者键盘的QE键调整视角高低，左键选中放置轨道或者物件，右键重做……操作起来十分别扭，而且在旋转镜头的时候，也是有些卡顿，鼠标操作起来很难受，键盘又不能顾及全部的功能，可以说是设计上的缺陷，希望在以后的版本中可以得到改进。


[h1]+ 舒缓悦耳的音乐

- 让人感觉不适的操作方式

- 优化不是特别好[/h1]

作为放松还是很值得一玩的，目前EA阶段的旅客模式并不是很有意思，相对比较无聊，运完一批又一批，后期还有时间限制，可能在前期就要规划好。希望官方能够加入Steam Workshop，为玩家提供自己制作MOD的机会，让玩家参与进来，能够建造更加多种多样的火车头、火车车厢、景物。

期待官方后期的制作，如果有重大更新的话，之后也会更新本篇评测。

个人评分6/10

Tracks The Train Set Game è quel trenino che tutti noi da piccoli abbiamo desiderato avere e per questioni di spazio non siamo mai riusciti ad avere! Si perchè mettere un trenino con dei binari in giro per la stanza, non è roba semplice eppure con Tracks lo si può fare senza dover preoccuparsi di distruggere tutto alla fine! 35568601.review:
This title started out as a free downloadable game.  Presumably the developer saw the level of interest and took the opportunity to enhance the game and make a few quid at the same time.  No issues there!

 Gameplay
*************
(coming soon)

 Quick REVIEW
*****************
  Pros
********
- Fantastic Idea.
- Beautifully represented.
- Nice gameplay mechanics (transporting characters etc..)
- Simple easy to use controls.
- UI is reasonably intuitive as is the game itself.

  Cons
********
- Early Access should be sold at a reduced price, especially when there is...
- Almost no content and nothing much to do!
- Bugs are present (I know EA).

 Overview
*************
At this point in time (Early Access) the game is very limited, gameplay options are all but non-existent and there are a number of bugs in the game....but the promise it shows is very good indeed.

My daughter, who has Autism, used to play with her wooden train sets a LOT as a child, every morning before and after breakfast a new track had to be constructed and she would play for hours!!  

This game was recommended to me by a well know YouTuber and I grabbed it because I thought she might get the same level of enjoyment from Tracks.  The draw being that she could build whatever she wanted without the drag of having to put it all away again; and she did but only for a short while.  

Maybe she has grown out of it now or maybe it is just the limited amount of gameplay currently in this title?  Either way I am sure I will be playing this game in the future if it continues to grow and add more content.  I very much like what I see but there is nowhere near enough content to justify the price at this time.

I am a firm believer in the following approach: Early Access titles should have a reduced price to thank those early investors who take a risk.  Not sure that is how this game has structured its pricing......BUT great hopes for the future, a quality idea with very nicely designed features, just needs some content!

Looking to turn this Not Recommended to Recommended as and when content is added or the price is reduced :-)

35499408.review:
[h1]评论 key 由开发 / 发行方通过奶牛关野蔷薇计划( https://cowlevel.net/wildrose )提供。	[/h1]

完整版评测链接：https://cowlevel.net/game/Tracks_The_Train_Set_Game/review/2754711

[h1]关于Tracks - The Train Set Game	[/h1]

这是一款充满童趣的作品～《轨道：火车模型游戏》作为一款铁路模拟游戏，与其他同类型游戏最大的不同便在于其将游戏背景巧妙的设定成为孩子们儿时玩耍的木质火车轨道玩具，不用考虑复杂的支架和力学，你甚至可以将自己的火车轨道铺设成过山车或者盘山公路！

而另一点有意思的要素便在于玩家在建设完毕轨道后，可以亲身坐上玩具小火车，以司机的视角来操纵着自己的小火车在轨道上疾驰，从桌下穿过，在椅子上绕圈，来满足你的儿时梦想～


[h1]游戏操作	[/h1]

操作上，目前轨道：火车模型游戏仅支持键盘与鼠标操作，操作虽然较为简单易上手，但是用鼠标滚轮来控制轨道的上下坡建造和视角总觉得不太适应


[h1]游戏模式	[/h1]

当前尚处于EA阶段，玩家只能选择在空空如也的空白场景或者是客厅场景中进行游玩

其中，空白场景内没有任何布景，可供玩家自由发挥创造，甚至可以创造一个自己的小镇～


而客厅场景则是一间常规的家庭配置，有沙发桌椅电器等，而玩家除了选择自由游玩外，还可以进行以运送乘客为目标的旅客模式，在这个模式中，系统会给出目标，而玩家所要做的便是根据系统要求造出轨道，然后将出现在电视机或者餐桌上的木制小人旅客们送到沙发上的站台等目的地~随着一批一批旅客在各处刷新，我们的小火车轨道也会随之慢慢拓展，直至覆盖满整个房间


[h1]个人向评价	[/h1]

《轨道：火车模型游戏》作为一款休闲向作品，可以让玩家在忙于刺激的对抗游戏之暇，在一座由自己打造的小镇里，切换到驾驶模式，然后看着自己的小火车在循环的轨道上一遍又一遍的跑着，体会那种自己创造世界的成就感。

《轨道：火车模型游戏》目前作为EA阶段游戏，虽然对于那些沙盒爱好者来说可以在自由模式里建造一座属于自己的玩具城市已经足够心满意足，但是不能掩盖除此之外游戏玩法的缺失。而在设施建造界面上大量的物品预览图都没有来得及添加更是说明了这款游戏还有待进一步添加内容

除此之外，操作上的某些奇葩按键设置也会对玩家造成部分不便，如果游戏有了自定义按键功能，则能让玩家在这方面的体验上提升不少

35346213.review:
[h1] Tracks-The Game [/h1]

Let me preface by saying that Tracks the Game is in Early Access, there are things that may or may not be changed until it's finalized in the official release. 

[h1] Overview [/h1]

Tracks the game is based on the wooden train sets like Brio and Thomas the Tank Engine toys. Building a rail networks, getting passengers is the name of the game. The game includes three modes; Free-Play, Passengers, and Frieght. Because it is in early access, I can see that there is a high ceiling of potential when it comes to creativity surrounding the community. I'll talk about that later on.

[h1] Free Play [/h1]

Free Play is the sandbox mode of the game, using unlimited resources, you can build a rail network that can be as big or small as you wish. While there is no objective, free play allows players to let their minds loose in designing their track layout.

[h1] Passengers [/h1]

Passengers is a small game mode at the moment where the player has to build a station platform near some passengers and build a track to get them to the station. It is a simple game, but it allows open-ended solutions to the 5-or-so missions it provides. 

Personally, getting the train at full speed to stop at the platforms and stations perfectly has been a personal challenge for me.

[h1] Frieght [/h1]

At the moment, Frieght is an unrelease game mode that has yet to be implemented. Other than knowing it as the third gamemode, I cannot delve further into it.

[h1] Audio [/h1]

The music of the game ressonates the inner kind in myself, building layouts in the small kids' room of the house all day. I think it would be better if there were more songs added to the list so that there is a little more variety. Otherwise, I would have it off for an ambient effect.

The sounds for the train rolling full-speed across the tracks is very satifying. I would hope the developers add some hollow wooden clinking noises betweem the passengers, to placing objects, to the cars pushing against each other to really [i] emphasize [/i] the wood asthetic.

[h1] "Maps" [/h1]

Tracks-The Game features two rooms to choose from and build in. 

The first room is a pink-ish/beige-ish, featureless room (akin to Garry's Mod's "gm_flatgrass." It is an open cube that allows the player to freely build layouts without any restrictions apart from the room boundaries (which in itself is well more than plentiful).

The second room called "Modern Apartment." You can infer that this room resembles modern apartment that features furnishings, tables, chairs, TVs, pitcures, counters, shelves, flooring, and pretty much anything you would find in an apartment. This room restricts some track layout, but forces the player to get creative when building their layout in free play and Passenger Mode

[h1] Miscellaneous [/h1]

[b] Workshop [/b]

I mentioned earlier that the game could benefit from a community-driven Steam Workshop if we were to take a page from Garry's Mod. Not only would some creative aspects be handled by the community, it would allow the developers to focus on other parts of the game. Maybe some of the more popular addons could be implemented as official releases by the Dev. team. 

People would be able to submit rooms, layouts, track pieces, trains, traincars, scenery, and themes that could spice-up an otherwise, normal wooden set.

[b] Pros [/b]

[list]
[*] Promising, high potential
[*] For an early access game, it is decently optimized
[*] The developers for the game are open to suggestions
[*] Buying this game now for $10 will allow for further development
[/list]

[b] Cons [/b]

[list]
[*] It [i] is [/i] in early access after all, not all features have been implemented yet
[*] Limited Track, Train, and scenery pieces
[*] Only two maps to build in to chose from at the moment
[/list]

35291725.review:
Generally, I don't like Early Access games. Or trains. But for some reason, this game jumped out at me, and I bought it on release.

So, addressing the Early Access portion of it. It's still rather limited in terms of structured gameplay. At the time of writing ( Sept 29 2017 ) there is a 'Pick up passengers and take them to a station' mode, and there is a 'free play' mode. The 'Passengers' mode finishes after about 8 or so passenger drop-offs. So, there isn't much to that yet.

But the whole toy train aesthetic and ease at building track is so bloody enjoyable, that the sandbox, Free mode is where you'll spend the bulk of your time anyway.

There's an excellent tutorial that takes you though the very intuitive laying of the track, and then you're let loose to go crazy, creating little cute villages and rattling through them at full speed.

There's definitely work that needs done to the game, but so far, it hasn't crashed or glitched on me, and it's just been such a gentle, enjoyable toybox.

35290197.review:
Tips:(重要资讯！)此游戏杉果Key只卖29块。[url=https://www.sonkwo.com/products/3090?game_id=3062]点击购买[/url]

[h1]简单而又纯粹的极简类模型游戏，优秀的“怀旧类”精品。
——《Tracks - The Train Set Game（轨道：模型游戏）》[/h1]

这款游戏我是预购的，从看到游戏介绍的时候起，我就觉得这款游戏一定不会让我失望。而事实上也是这样的。
这款游戏我暂时还没有玩多久，可能没有多么深刻的理解。并且这篇评测以后还会继续更新，如果有评测不够公允的地方，欢迎指出~

[h1]简单而又纯粹，回味童真[/h1]
和《模拟城市》、《都市：天际线》这类大型模拟类游戏不同，这款游戏仅有简单的轨道铺设，稍微辅以周边景物的添加，所以并没有那么强的真实感。
但正因这样，却也是这款游戏的出彩之处：[b]这份纯粹的简单，仿佛让人想起了孩提时期玩“奥迪双钻四驱车”的童真，勾起心中许多的美好回忆[/b]

[i]就像童年时候玩的那些模型玩具一样，体会童年时候的感受。而这款游戏更是能让它动起来，仿佛做到了小时候憧憬的事情，带来更多的触动。[/i]

[h1]稍有诟病的操作方式[/h1]
这款游戏的操作方式，在我看来是比较怪异的。
用WASD控制视角的横向移动，鼠标控制视角方向，中键滚轮控制视角升降。整个就是这样一种“类似于FSP类游戏”的操作方式。这与当下的主流操作模式是大相径庭的，在游戏过程中总让我操作很不舒服。
不管是《都市：天际线》这样的模拟类游戏，或是3D's Max或者Creo这样的3维建模软件，都选择的是用鼠标中键来控制视角。并且我也是更喜欢这样的操作方式，况且既然主流软件都选择了这样的方式，就一定有其优势吧！

[h1]独具特色的木质纹理风格[/h1]
不得不说，这款游戏独具特色的木质纹理，使整个游戏基调显得十分轻松惬意。并且更加重了这种怀旧风格，给玩家以更多的触动。
并且，简单的贴图也减缓了显卡负担。而简单的游戏模式与建模，也带来了十分[u]亲民[/u]的配置要求，这是一款[b]比《饥荒》还要更加大众的游戏[/b]。

[h1]简单的游戏元素，大众通俗的游戏难度[/h1]
游戏的操作方式十分简单，虽然没有中文，但这并不影响玩家们快速上手。这正好和《都市：天际线》那样完整而又复杂的游戏难度相反。
在《天际线》里，如果没有你看得懂的语言，似乎很难坚持玩下去吧？而就算有了中文，你要从新手开始迅速熟悉游戏变成dalao，怎么说也要好几个小时时间吧？
但在这款游戏里，所有的一切，你几乎都能在5分钟内搞定。
当然这也是因为游戏元素少，所以会比较容易腻，很快便会失去新鲜感而觉得无趣。而《天际线》这样的“硬核游戏”，几乎都能消耗掉你几十上百个小时的时间。
但说到底这只是一款休闲游戏而已，而具体你喜欢这哪种呢？见仁见智吧！

[h1]好评推荐！喜加一优选名单[/h1]
从综合上来说，这款游戏绝对算得上精品，起码是小品级的精品游戏。
[i]起码它对得起36这个价格，不会让你失望。[/i]

综合评分：6.9/10

35279942.review:
[h1]回味童真[/h1]

首先感谢杉果点评小分队提供的测试机会。
================================
beta testing版本与真实购买版本不同，
完整体验请购买游戏正版许可。

[h1]轨道：模型游戏[/h1]
[h1]Tracks - The Train Set Game Beta Testing评测[/h1]

大家好我是少年粥。
轨道：模拟游戏，并不是我第一次接触steam上的模拟类游戏，但却是令人难忘的一款。相较于其它大型模拟游戏，本作可以说是十分纯粹、地道的模拟类游戏。

[h1] 游戏特点[/h1]
画面逼真、音效到位
首先进入游戏后，简约风格的主菜单上用细字体写着：游戏、地图选择、存档读档、控制选项以及退出。游戏中小火车的木质纹理以及在轨道上转弯时的晃动都相当逼真，Free模式可以自由搭建喜欢的轨道，你甚至可以自己驾驶木质小火车，自由穿梭在游戏的世界里。

[h1] 游戏玩法[/h1]
搭建你自己的火车轨道！或是在乘客模式中来回拉客以赚取☆！相信我，一进入游戏，你就会有一种小时候搭积木玩具的感觉！逼真的木质纹理更完美地还原了一切小时候不能达成的心愿！不要管什么乘客了，在free模式里都可以玩得不亦乐乎！

[h1] 游戏吐槽[/h1]
因为是全3D游戏，游戏中可能会出现双PU炸裂的情况。这属于正常（因为我是A卡）。
如果你试着把所有的轨道都拆除，你就可以开着小火车到处跑了！亲测，有效！
建议把轨道都设计完成后再开动火车，否则客还没接到，翻车了……

[h1] 购买建议[/h1]
这是一款值得一玩的游戏，在玩过了csgo、吃鸡等正邪势不两立或是你死我活的游戏之后，作为一款放松身心、回味童年的作品，轨道：模型游戏可以满足你渴望宁静的心。我们不去比较csgo里MVP的荣耀，不去比较吃鸡的愉悦。如果你的内心还有一份属于木质玩具的热爱，那么这款游戏，一定值得你拥有。

[h1] 粥粥评分[/h1]
画面：★★★★☆
音效：★★★★☆
情怀：★★★★★
游戏性：★★★☆☆
性价比：★★★☆☆

Стильненькие домики, симпатичные деревца и прочие украшательства, множество промышленных зданий и возможность строить железную дорогу на разных уровнях высоты. Всё это позволит вспомнить детство и поиграть в железную дорогу, но уже с графоном и возможностью сесть в собственный поезд и прокатить жителей.

Для игроков со слабым железом конечно же существуют низкие настройки графики, но даже на них игра немного подлагивает *грустно вздыхает и гладит свой ноут*. Впрочем, это инди, а в этом разделе магазина Steam не стоит ждать крутой оптимизации. Но хотелось бы, да.

По итогу советую потыкать эту игру (но покупать исключительно на распродаже!) всем любителям песочниц и конечно же тем, у кого не было в детстве собственной железной дороги. 39997348.review:
Cute little wooden train game.

It's like retrieval of the long-lost childhood where you play with wooden tracks and wooden trains right in the living room. Playing it with a relaxed smile all over my face...

The start is easy. With some simple commands, you are able to build and alter your first tracks. After finishing it, you jump first-person into your train and explore your very own creation from inside. 
Besides free buildup, you also can go for missions at some places, where you are requested to transport passengers to the railway station or restaurant. 

It is all very well created and shows up with nice details. It is still in early access, so we certainly will see more progress. If you could get it on a sale, go for it, you will get amazed.

Die Basis des Spiels (Strecken bauen) funktioniert bereits sehr gut, aber der Rest ist noch ziemlich Baustelle und der Passagiermodus wirkt recht aufgesetzt. An die Steuerung mit der Maus gewöhnt man sich überraschend schnell, man sollte allerdings in der HUD eine Anzeige haben, in welchen Modus man sich befindet.

Man sollte den Entwicklern noch viel Zeit geben, vielleicht ein halbes Jahr oder Jahr, dann ist auch genug Rundherum da, es gemeinsam mit jüngeren Verwandten zu spielen. Unterm Strich sollte man das Spiel im Auge behalten, es ist ein noch ungeschliffener Diamant.

I've really enjoyed my time with this game (even if it's a small amount) and I believe the dev asked for tips so here are the two I have.
1) We should be able to let tracks join from all 4 directions in a way that allows you to choose to go right or left, instead of just forwards. I feel like that would make things a bit less awkward. 
This brings me to some other track suggestions: allowing tracks to split left and right at the same time and allowing two curved tracks to meet and form a single track
2) I'd also like to see a full piano available for the music notes. I'm trying to recreate a song I love and don't have access to the lower notes I need to finish it, which is one of those "it would be so easy to make this perfect" moments. A lot of games with interactive music seem to have this issue so I'd love to see it fixed.

For all I know the devs had these ideas anyway, so it could just be a matter of time.
